intro: Bulbocodium fontanesii, commonly known as the mountain sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, often in well-drained soils. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers in early spring, and its leaves are usually basal, forming a rosette. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes other flowering plants with showy blooms. Bulbocodium fontanesii is often found in high-altitude habitats and is adapted to cold, harsh climates.
